report_title: Personal Injury Lawyers & Attorneys Industry Report
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. A consistent flow of legal cases and a rapid recovery following the pandemic has helped personal injury lawyers and attorneys endure growth over the past five years, albeit with slight volatility. Many firms rely on cases related to automobile accidents, which plummeted in 2020, as fewer individuals were on the road. Personal injury lawyers focused in other specialties or running more generalized practices fared better. Overall, revenue is expected to rise at a CAGR of 2.0% to an estimated $57.3 billion, including an estimated increase of 0.4% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Economic Activity Contributes to Uneven Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Cases related to automobile accidents represent the largest source of revenue for the industry, with some firms focusing solely on such cases. In 2020, the number of vehicle accidents plummeted 22.3%, as the proliferation of remote work kept many people off the roads. As economic conditions improved and consumer activity resumed following the pandemic, the frequency of fatal crashes increased, with fatal crashes growing 9.9% in 2021, according to the latest data from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Elderly Population Continues to be a Core Revenue Stream for Lawyers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Medical malpractice cases involve the negligence of a medical professional or institution, which causes injury to a patient. Many elder care facilities experienced worker shortages amid the pandemic, resulting in poor conditions for patients and an increase in medical malpractice cases. Since older patients are most susceptible to a variety of diseases and medical conditions, it generates greater demand among the elderly population, particularly since this age demographic has the strongest disposable incomes.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Joint Liability Cases Yield Larger Settlements
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Joint liability cases are pursued when there are two or more liable parties, which is mainly common in large-scale cases, such as medical malpractice. Plaintiffs often target joint liability scenarios when any single liable party is unlikely to meet the financial damages alone. Since joint liability cases can lead to substantial payouts, they mostly result in structured settlements that spread payments over a specified period rather than as a lump sum, generating longer-term revenue for lawyers successfully litigating such cases.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Usage of Artificial Intelligence (AI) Helps Automate and Improvise Lawyers' Case Preparation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A critical development in recent years has been the implementation and adoption of automated intelligence (AI), with prominent programs such as ChatGPT playing an integral role in lawyers' daily processes. The use of AI within the legal process helps attorneys strengthen their legal arguments prior to going on trial, with AI providing top-of-the-line analysis on case data, legal document preparation and even potential settlement figures if the case heads into that direction.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Growing Elderly Population Will Drive Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number of adults aged 65 and older is poised to increase, driving the number of malpractice cases up and expanding the potential marketplace for personal injury lawyers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: HIGH WAGE COSTS WILL LIMIT PROFIT GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Personal injury lawyers and attorneys command relatively high wages, due to the specialization of their practice. High wage costs will prohibit further profit growth, as firms place greater emphasis on retaining talent and legal expenses are poised to accelerate following high inflation.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DIVERSE ARRAY OF DEMAND NICHES WILL CONTINUE BOOSTING SPECIALIZED LAWYER DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number of vehicle accidents is expected to rise over the next five years, resulting in more vehicle-related cases.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Expansion of Technology Will Accelerate Lawyers' Efficiency in Organizing and Communicating With Clients
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As personal injury attorneys continue to look for ways to maximize efficiency in client engagement and document organization, the adoption of the latest technological trends will enhance operator effectiveness in pursuing multiple cases.

industry_definition: This industry comprises legal practitioners (i.e. lawyers or attorneys) that primarily practice personal injury law.

opportunities: Number of adults aged 65 and older

key_trends: Competition between personal injury law firms is intense. Successful firms leverage their reputation to win over potential clients, with law firms that deliver consistent results in terms of successful settlements generating stronger standing within the industry.

Marketing efforts have increased amid heightened competition. While traditionally a word-of-mouth business, many firms have allocated greater funds toward digital marketing avenues, with social media platforms such as Facebook and Instagram attracting a wider client pool.

Revenue increased despite economic volatility and operational hurdles. High inflationary pressures and dampened consumer confidence following the pandemic caused major shake ups for personal injury law firms, with certain case types declining drastically, but most weathered the storm.

Continued necessity of legal representation will bolster operator demand. With the number of vehicle accidents poised to accelerate and a growing older adult population, newfound demand will be generated among niche consumers.
The average personal injury law firm employs about three people. As a result, no single law firm accounts for more than 5.0% of revenue.
